page.title: 07THE MEDIA IN N.W.NEWCASTLE.
page.content: Children's lives are now dominated by {T.V.}and new forms of technology are affecting leisure time.From a survey of 54 pupils (11-12 yrs old) it was found that 41 had their own T.V.Some homes had up to 4 sets.Pupils spent on average over{4 hours a day}watching T.V.,with some watching it for as many as 8 hours a day.Favourite programmes include "That's Life","The Young Ones" and sports programmmes.20 pupils had {videos.}Remarkably,{cinema}remains popular with 40 paying to see new releases quite regularly. 27 children had{computers},so computer games are now an addition to the traditional leisure activities.{Radio}is also very popular for pop music.Most houses recieved a{newspaper}but pupils rarely read them.About 60% of the boys read {comics},girls preferred pop and fashion{magazines.
